newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon's Hariri announces socio-economic plan.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon's Hariri announces socio-economic plan.

text.p: Following are the main economic and social development proposals in Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri's policy statement to parliament on Tuesday:
1. Launching a new policy aimed at promoting the industrial, agricultural and touristic sectors by:
a. Preparing a bill to set up a separate ministry for
industry instead of the former ministry for oil and industry.
b. Encouraging industrial and agricultural investment.
c. Providing and facilitating credit for agricultural
projects.
d. Negotiating new bilateral and multilateral agreements
to market Lebanese agricultural products.

2. Creating new job opportunities though encouraging individuals to launch small and medium-sized firms. The government will promote this policy by establishing a public institution to provide credit guarantees for these firms.
3. To continue the state housing policy in which commercial banks are expected to play a serious role in agreement with the central bank.
4. Organising the public health sector.
5. Expanding public transportation services to include new areas in the capital and the rest of the country.
6. Developing social security.
7. Improving state-run schools and developing public education while strengthening vocational education.
8. To preserve academic independence of the state-run Lebanese university.
9. To maintain economic, financial and social stability:
a. The government's policy will remain unchanged with
regard to carrying out development projects, accelerating growth and increasing state revenues.
b. The government will try to attract Lebanese capital
both inside and outside Lebanon.
